messages.message: :wave: I noticed earlier today that we allow search engines to index the public files we have hosted on ib prod, and they sometimes come up when Googling for Instabase-related things (noticed this when Googling "instabase bug bounty"). This also includes some links to dogfood-002.instabase.com (http://dogfood-002.instabase.com). Should we mark these links unindexable?
we should probably make all pages un-indexable, except for our wordpress marketing website

just need to add https://developers.google.com/search/docs/advanced/crawling/block-indexing to our http templates

cc @Jessica
and in the filesystem handlers in `webapp` for handling single files
Thanks - this is an ongoing and significant issue. Large parts of our dog food environment are being indexed and also giving error messages impacting our google score
@Serena so you're thinking in our layout html files?
yep! and also the responses returned by `_handle_file` in `webserver/webapp/src/py/instabase/handler/views/filesystems.py`
